Description:
Our client, a high-end multi-brand Hospitality developer is hiring a Tax Controller.Based in their Riyadh Head office you will be responsible for analysing and interpreting tax regulations and preparing required tax reports so that the organization meets its tax obligations and objectives. Successful implementation of VAT with coordination with all concerned parties.
Maintain controls by adhering to the accounting department’s policies and procedures and ensure Tax practices are in compliance with Kingdom of Saudi Arabia financial reporting statutes, standards, and financial reporting best practices.
Review and monitor custom duties and excise duties in line with the law and regulations.
Reconcile accounts, post journal entries, and maintain a complete and accurate general ledger in accordance with accounting principles and reporting schedules so that the organization has a full and accurate statement of its financial position related to the Tax.
Process Tax related payments to ensure they are processed accurately and on time (e.g. WHT monthly payment, filing of WHT returns, VAT returns, etc.)
Review invoices entries in the system, ensure all payments have the necessary approvals and signatures, prepare reconciliation checks, and process payments as per the company policies & procedures and the third party contract agreement.
Monitor and resolve issues relating to approvals, record discrepancies (if any), billing discrepancies and incorrect information on the accounts related to taxation
Conduct day-to-day transactional processing and reporting on taxation. This includes the accurate posting of all tax-related entries.
Researching, analyzing, and interpreting changing tax legislation inside the kingdom.
Monitor the tax liability related to WHT, VAT and Zakat on a monthly basis.
Working with tax laws in the Kingdom and updating the changes.
Compile, verify, and analyze financial information, and prepare financial reports and accounting statements so that senior management has accurate and timely information for making financial decisions.
These reports may include monthly VAT liabilities, WHT returns, VAT returns, regulatory reports and filings
Communicate and report the status of pending critical payments to ensure management's awareness of delays affecting the company’s operations and incurred financial liabilities.
Prepare period-end closing transactions (monthly/quarterly/annually).
Keep up to date  on any changes in taxation regulation or principles inside the kingdom and internationally.Skills
Skills:
Bachelor degree Accounting
4 to 7 years of experience in a similar role
Good knowledge of taxation programs, tax filing, and tax returns/ claims.
Problem Solving Skills
Communication Skills
Excellent Presentation Skills
Computer Literacy (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Detail Orientation
